channel.title: 317 Please - Help Changing ::yell message colors and ::message color
channel.description: Okay I've been trying to figure out how to change the color to ::yell messages and ::message but when I tried @gre@ or something it didn't work what am I suppose to put in.. Please help!

item.title: 317 Please - Help Changing ::yell message colors and ::message color
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“pobdol, post:5, topic:379986”][quote author=rova1 link=topic=475830.msg3479620#msg3479620 date=1295995474]
your client doesn’t support it, try this tut:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

it’s a little old but theres tonnes out there:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


[/quote]

That’s for changing your text before and after in client… I’m talking about in server. Like I know my server supports some colors cause I have titles changed with @gre@ etc. But @gre@ doesn’t work with the ::yell[/quote]

Every Client supports those colours… You just need to get the colours to work in the chatbox, and the tutorial that rash gave you should work.

Read full topic
item.source: 317 Please - Help Changing ::yell message colors and ::message color

item.title: 317 Please - Help Changing ::yell message colors and ::message color
item.dc:creator: @pobdol pobdol
item.description:
@pobdol wrote:

[quote=“Ferity, post:2, topic:379986”]For example at the message command, just change it to

yell("@gre@[SERVER]"…);
You have to put the @gre@ behind the "[/quote]

That doesn’t work. This is the text I got:

[code]

            }
	if (playerRights == 0) {
                titles = "[Player] ";[/code]

And when I put in titles = "@gre@[Player] "; in-game it comes up as @gre@[Player]Hi

And when I try and do titles = @gre@"[Player] "; I get 100 errors…

Read full topic
item.source: 317 Please - Help Changing ::yell message colors and ::message color
